core Package¶

ap_monitor Module¶

AP Monitor module to track ap status and received messages

class core.ap_monitor.APMonitor(dispatcher, aurora_db, host, username, password)[source]¶

Bases: object

Handles AMQP response messages from access points.

SLEEP_TIME = 45¶
get_stats(ap)[source]¶

Query the access point for slice stats.

poll_AP(ap_name, stop_event=None)[source]¶

Poller thread target: sends the access point a message in a regular interval.

Parameters:ap_name (str) – Name of the access point
process_response(channel, method, props, body)[source]¶

Processes any responses it sees, checking to see if the correlation ID matches one sent. If it does, the response is displayed along with the request originally sent.

reset_AP(ap)[source]¶

Reset the access point. If there are serious issues, however, a restart may be required.

restart_AP(ap)[source]¶

Restart the access point, telling the OS to reboot.

restart_slices(ap, slice_list)[source]¶

Restarts the slices on their access point.

Parameters:
  • ap (str) – Name of the access point
  • slice_list (list) – List of slices to restart
set_status(cmd_category, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This function’s arguments used to look like unique_id, success, ap_up=True, ap_name=None

start_poller(ap_name)[source]¶

Starts a poller to track the status of an access point.

Parameters:ap_name (str) – Name of the access point
stop()[source]¶

Stops threads created by AP Monitor

timeout(ap_slice_id, ap_name, message_uuid=None)[source]¶

This code will execute when a response is not received for the command associated with the unique_id after a certain time period. It modifies the database to reflect the current status of the AP.

update_records(message)[source]¶

Update the traffic information of ap_slice

Parameters:message (dict) – Message containing reported slice stats

cls_logger Module¶

LOGGER importer module for class use

class core.cls_logger.CustomFormatter(fmt=None, datefmt=None)[source]¶

Bases: logging.Formatter

Extends logging.Formatter class with a custom formatting method

format(record)[source]¶

Formats the logged message to include a tag with the calling module and class name with the tag length no longer than specified self.max_width_limit. Also tracks which classes are calling the format function, if it is a new class the class name is added to class_loggers list. Note: ‘core.’ is removed from all module names if it exists

[module_name—-ClassName] Logged Message

Parameters:record (LogRecord) – LogRecord with log information
Return type:str
max_width = 0¶
max_width_limit = 30¶
normalize(width_map)[source]¶

Normalizes a given mapping of module and class name lengths, zeroing values above self.max_width_limit.

Parameters:width_map (list) – List containing lengths of logger name strings
Return type:list
core.cls_logger.get_cls_logger(cls)[source]¶

Assign a logger to a class only if no prior logger has been assigned

Parameters:cls (class) – Class to which LOGGER should be assigned
Return type:logging.Logger
core.cls_logger.set_up_root_logger(level=None)[source]¶

Sets up the root logger with a handler created by setup_handler() method. Sets root logging level to provided level arg, defaults is WARN

Parameters:level (logging.level) – Desired level of logging, specified in logging module
core.cls_logger.setup_handler()[source]¶

Sets up a StreamHandler on the root logger and assigns it a custom formatter.

Return type:logging.StreamHandler

request_verification Module¶

shell_local Module¶

Command-line interface to the Aurora API Uses a JSON file for commands:

Format:[
         {
          optional:[[oarg1, {attributes}],[oarg2, {attributes}]...], 
          positional:[[parg1, {attributes}], [parg2, {attributes}]...], 
          subargument:[[subarg1, {attributes}, [[osarg1, {attributes}], [osarg2, {attributes}]]], [subarg2, {attributes}]...]
         }
       ]
class core.shell_local.AuroraArgumentParser(prog=None, usage=None, description=None, epilog=None, version=None, parents=[], formatter_class=<class 'argparse.HelpFormatter'>, prefix_chars='-', fromfile_prefix_chars=None, argument_default=None, conflict_handler='error', add_help=True)[source]¶

Bases: argparse.ArgumentParser

base_parser()[source]¶
class core.shell_local.AuroraConsole[source]¶

Bases: object

main(argv)[source]¶

stop_thread Module¶

Module containing threads which can run a continuous loop until a stop event is thrown. Thread target code must have a keyword argument for stop_event and must check it periodically eg.:

if stop_event.is_set(): break
class core.stop_thread.StoppableThread(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: threading.Thread

Thread class with a stop method to terminate timers that have been started

add_stop_argument(kwargs)[source]¶
stop()[source]¶
stopped()[source]¶
